trans-unit.source: Clustering algorithms are algorithms that learn to group a set of items together based on a set of features.
trans-unit.target: Clustering algorithms are algorithms that learn to group a set of items together based on a set of features.

trans-unit.source: For example, clustering is often used in text analysis to group pieces of text that contain common words together.
trans-unit.target: For example, clustering is often used in text analysis to group pieces of text that contain common words together.

trans-unit.source: Clustering can be used to group unlabeled data by figuring out which data points are closest together, and then determining the centroid, or central point, of each grouping.
trans-unit.target: Clustering can be used to group unlabeled data by figuring out which data points are closest together, and then determining the centroid, or central point, of each grouping.

trans-unit.source: Once the algorithm is trained, it can be used to predict which cluster an instance of data belongs to.
trans-unit.target: Once the algorithm is trained, it can be used to predict which cluster an instance of data belongs to.
